radproc.arcgis.join_df_columns_to_attribute_table¶

radproc.arcgis.join_df_columns_to_attribute_table(df, joinField, columns, fc)¶

Join DataFrame columns to attribute table of a feature class or shapefile.

Parameters:
df : pandas DataFrame
with data columns to be joined to attribute table.
joinField : String
Name of join field. This field name must be containined in DataFrame and attribute table.
columns : List of Strings
containing names of columns which are to be joined to Feature Class. Must NOT contain the name of joinField.
fc : String
Path and Name of Feature Class.
Returns:
None
Note:

If the join is supposed to be done based on the DataFrame index, you have to create a new column with the same name as the join field of the feature class. So, if you have a DataFrame with gauge station numbers as index and your feature class already contains a field called “Statnr” with the corresponding station numbers, you need to new to create a new column with

>>> df['Statnr'] = df.index
